keyFactors.title: Historical Dominance
keyFactors.description: 8-0 H2H streak vs Phoenix dating back to April 2024, 7-1 ATS in stretch

keyFactors.title: Suns Injuries
keyFactors.description: Phoenix missing Grayson Allen and Jalen Green - backcourt depleted

keyFactors.title: Matchup Advantage
keyFactors.description: Wolves' length (Gobert, Towns successor) historically dominates Suns

riskFactors: Suns due for regression to mean eventually
Edwards can be inconsistent on the road

edwards.note: Missed 2 crucial FTs with 12.7 sec left

quarterBreakdown.description: Wolves continued solid play, building lead

gameResults.whenMissed: Final 69 seconds - Wolves were 8-point favorites with 1:09 left and lost outright
gameResults.turningPoint: Edwards missed 2 free throws with 12.7 seconds left that would have sealed win. Gillespie hit game-winner with 6.4 seconds left.

whatWentWrong.title: Brutal Collapse
whatWentWrong.description: Led 113-105 with 1:09 remaining - should have been easy cover. 0-9 run to end game.

whatWentWrong.title: Edwards Free Throws
whatWentWrong.description: Missed both free throws with 12.7 seconds left that would have sealed the win

whatWentWrong.title: Defensive Breakdown
whatWentWrong.description: Allowed Gillespie game-winning jumper with 6.4 seconds left

statisticalContext.vsSeasonAverage: Edwards had 41 points - great performance wasted
statisticalContext.vsPropLine: Would have covered -4.5 easily with 1:09 left
statisticalContext.percentileRanking: Historic bad beat - 99th percentile of bad beats

postGameAnalysis.wasNormalVariance: This is not normal variance - this is a historic collapse. Leading by 8 with 1:09 left and losing outright is extremely rare. The bet was correct until the final minute.

closingLineValue.verdict: Positive CLV - market moved toward our position. We were right, just got incredibly unlucky.

keyTakeaways: Historic collapse - led by 8 with 1:09 left and lost outright
Edwards' 41 points completely wasted by late-game execution
8-game H2H streak ended in worst possible fashion
Thesis was 100% correct until final 69 seconds
This is variance, not bad analysis - would bet this again every time
verdict: This was a BAD BEAT of historic proportions. We had the game won - 113-105 with 1:09 left. Edwards missed 2 FTs, Gillespie hit game-winner. This is pure variance. The analysis was correct, the bet was correct, execution failed. 10/10 would bet again.
